III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4543
Section Doors
Description (e) Be equipped with at least knob-type, properly operating,
approved, positive-latching, nonlocking-against-egress-type
hardware which ensures the opening of the door with a single
motion, such as turning a knob or applying pressure of normal
strength on a latch, except where otherwise provided by subrule
(2) of this rule and R 400.4545.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation There are delayed egress doors at this non-secure facility.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed on 09/08/2025 via telephone.
Complainant reported the facility is a non-secure facility with
delayed egress doors and delayed doors are not permitted in a
non-secure facility.
Director was interviewed on 09/09/2025 at the facility. Director
reported the facility has four units that have delayed egress doors.
The doors require holding the handle down for 30 seconds and
the door will open. Staff members carry keys that will
automatically open and reset the door lock. Director reported most
of the youths know that doors open if they hold the handle down
for 30 seconds.
Administrator was interviewed on 09/19/2025 via telephone.
Administrator reported she does not recall being informed during
the licensing rules review meeting that delayed egress doors are
not permitted in non-secure CCI’s. Administrator reported the
Bureau of Fire Services and DCWL Consultant inspected the
facility and there were no concerns regarding the facility having
delayed egress doors.
Manager with the Bureau of Fires Services was interviewed on
09/19/2025. Manager reported that delayed egress doors are not
permitted in non-secure facilities.
DCWL Manager was interviewed on 09/23/2025. Manager
reported that Administrator was informed during the licensing rule
committee meeting that delayed egress doors are not allowed in a
non-secure facility.
Tour:
A walk through was completed and found that egress doors, exit
doors, internal hallway doors all have delay locking hardware for
2

15-30 seconds (30 for the external doors and 15 for the internal
doors). The internal door handles must be held down for 15
seconds and the doors will open. The egress door handles must
be held down for 30 seconds and the door will open.
Documents Reviewed:
• Facility Program Statement policy states the facility is a
non-secure residential facility.
• Child Caring Institution Application for New Directions-
Livonia indicates the setting is non-secure.
• Terms of the license for New Directions Livonia states they
are a non-secure facility.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance as per interviews and a
tour of the facility, the facility was found to have delayed egress
doors, delayed exit doors, and delayed hallway doors which is not
permitted for non-secure child caring institutions.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
